intro: Agelaea cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian agelaea, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and terrestrial plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
